tp:docstring.p: Interface to use by a software implementation of media streaming.
On new Call.DRAFT channels, handlers should wait for CodecOffer.DRAFT objects to appear (one will either already be present, or will appear at some point in the channel's lifetime).

If the Call is incoming, then the codec offer's RemoteContactCodecMap will already be filled with the codec information of the remote contacts. Depending on the protocol, an outgoing call's RemoteContactCodecMap will either be filled with remote contact codec information, or it will be empty. If empty, then this SHOULD be interpreted to mean that all codecs are supported. Once a compatible list of codecs has been decided, CodecOffer.DRAFT.Accept should be called with the details of these codecs.

tp:member.name: Identifier
tp:member.tp:docstring: Numeric identifier for the codec. This will be used as the PT in the SDP or content description.

tp:member.name: Channels
tp:member.tp:docstring: Number of channels of the codec if applicable, otherwise 0.

tp:mapping.name: Contact_Codec_Map
tp:mapping.tp:docstring: A map from contact to the list of codecs he or she supports.

tp:member.name: Codecs
tp:member.tp:docstring: The codecs that the contact supports.

tp:struct.name: Codec_Offering
tp:struct.tp:docstring: A codec offer and its corresponding remote contact codec map.

tp:member.name: Codec_Offer
tp:member.tp:docstring: The object path to the CodecOffer.DRAFT

tp:member.name: Remote_Contact_Codec_Map
tp:member.tp:docstring: The CodecOffer.DRAFT.RemoteContactCodecMap property of the codec offer.

tp:docstring.p: Emitted when the codecs in use change.
As well as acting as change notification for the ContactCodecMap, emission of this signal implies that the CodecOffer property has changed to ('/', {}).

arg.name: Updated_Codecs
arg.tp:docstring: A map from contact to his or her codecs. Each pair in this map is added to the ContactCodecMap property, replacing any previous pair with that key.

arg.name: Removed_Contacts
arg.tp:docstring: A list of keys which were removed from the ContactCodecMap, probably because those contacts left the call.

method.name: UpdateCodecs
method.tp:docstring: Update the local codec mapping. This method should only be used during an existing call to update the codec mapping.

arg.name: Codecs
arg.tp:docstring: The codecs now supported by the local user.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotAvailable
tp:error.tp:docstring: Raised when not used during an existing call to update the codec mapping.

tp:docstring.p: A map from contact handles (including the local user's own handle) to the codecs supported by that contact.
Change notification is via the CodecsChanged signal.
Emitted when a new CodecOffer.DRAFT appears. The streaming implementation MUST respond by calling the Accept or Reject method on the codec offer object.
Emission of this signal indicates that the CodecOffer property has changed to (Offer, Codecs).

arg.name: Offer
arg.tp:docstring: The object path of the new codec offer. This replaces any previous codec offer.

tp:docstring.p: The CodecOffer.DRAFT.RemoteContactCodecMap property of the codec offer.
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: Having the RemoteContactCodecMap property here saves a D-Bus round-trip - it shouldn't be necessary to get the property from the CodecOffer object, in practice.

tp:docstring.p: The object path to the current CodecOffer.DRAFT object, and its CodecOffer.DRAFT.RemoteContactCodecMap property. If the object path is "/" then there isn't an outstanding codec offer, and the mapping MUST be empty.
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: Having the RemoteContactCodecMap property here saves a D-Bus round-trip - it shouldn't be necessary to get the property from the CodecOffer object, in practice.
tp:docstring.p: Change notification is via the NewCodecOffer (which replaces the value of this property with a new codec offer), and CodecsChanged (which implies that there is no longer any active codec offer) signals.
